intro: Deprea orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco deprea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
